ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to draw still life drawings, how to collage, how to draw what's actually in front of me instead of the idea of something, developing art skills
I was able to engage in fun and soothing art experiences that also helped me hone my skills.

I learned basic still life and figure drawing skills as well as how drawing spills over into other areas of art making. We created collages in addition to drawing. It was very nice to have a super open-ended final project, as we were all encouraged to branch out in creative directions.
definitely hugely expanded my interest in art and my confidence in my skills as an artist.
I had the opportunity to practice drawing, which I previously had never really done before, particularly figure drawing.
I practiced drawing, sketching, and developing visual projects. I started to think about art analytically.
Improved my drawing skills, explored a creative outlet, learned from the artistic decisions of my peers.
Drawing what you see instead of what you think you see. Working with color.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths
-great workload
-great feedback
-helps you explore the kind of art you want to make

Weaknesses
-greading is slightly unclear
The course was great!

This course was well-organized, well-paced, and well-taught. I did not feel overly rushed on any of the assignments and felt that I had sufficient time to learn through playing with different materials. The only aspect of the course I did not like was starting on Zoom for the first weeks, but that could not be helped.

It's really lame that the only way you can get into art courses is if you're a senior or a declared art major. If I had gotten into this course as a frosh, I probably would have ended up majoring in art/it totally would have changed my Yale trajectory. Bummed that I only got to experience this as a senior.

Strengths: it is a very cool class
Weaknesses: Felt unfair to be judged on drawing skills sometimes when there wasnt explanation give on how to improve

This course gave me exposure to different drawing styles (particularly figure drawing) that really advanced my skills. However, it was perhaps too critique-focused--I've taken art classes before where frequent critiques made sense, but in this class it just felt like they cut into practice time, which was the real thing that made me improve.

Great class, great drawing exercises and professor suggestions. 

I think the class could improve with fewer people in the class (shorter crits) and shifting the timing of the collage assignment.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: ABSOLUTELY! Matt is super cool, the workload is super manageable, you receive lots of feedback, and you get to try to draw lots of things
This was a great class and I liked that it was modified to accommodate non majors.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. I thoroughly enjoyed having Professor Keegan as my instructor. I loved the breadth of projects we completed and how we were encouraged to explore and try new things. I grew substantially as an artist through this course, and so did all of my classmates.
For sure. If you can get in.
Yes
Yes, this is a fun class that genuinely improved my drawing and expanded my creativity.
YESS!!! Take for sure
Yes! This is a great class.
